content.question:
<math alttext="The figure presents a 2 row table, with 5 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “theta,” and the heading for row 2 is “r.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. theta is 0. r is 1. Column 2. theta is one fourth. r is 4. Column 3. theta is one half. r is 3. Column 4. theta is three fourths. r is 5. Column 5. theta is 1. r is 2." overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="3em 0.05em 3em 3em 3em 3em 3em" equalrows="true" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0.5ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="1ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>θ</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="2.0ex" height="3.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mtd><mtd><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mtd><mtd><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>r</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

Let <math alttext="uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the region bounded by the graph of the polar curve <math alttext="r equals, f of theta" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and the lines <math alttext="theta equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="theta equals 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shaded in the figure above. The table above gives values of the polar function <math alttext="r equals, f of theta" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> at selected values of <math alttext="theta" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the approximation for the area of region <math alttext="uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> using a right Riemann sum with the four subintervals indicated by the data in the table?

choices.label: <math alttext="one fourth times, open parenthesis, 1 plus 4, plus 3, plus 5, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="one fourth times, open parenthesis, 4 plus 3, plus 5, plus 2, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="one eighth times, open parenthesis, 1 plus 16, plus 9, plus 25, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>16</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>25</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="one eighth times, open parenthesis, 16 plus 9, plus 25, plus 4, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>16</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>25</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="one eighth times, open parenthesis, 16 plus 9, plus 25, plus 4, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>16</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>25</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.9: (BC ONLY) Finding the Area of the Region Bounded by Two Polar Curves

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
